results.title: The Choice is yours (Industrial safety)
results.creator_credit: Colin Fox, Erika Hellfritsch, John Ward, Ken Daley and Drayton Film Productions
results.brief_description: Considers the problems of industrial safety on civil engineering construction sites. Makes the point that it is not the obviously risky jobs and locations that cause the majority of accidents but simple carelessness. Reconstructs accidents, and stresses the value of goggles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Fox, Erika Hellfritsch, John Ward, Ken Daley and Drayton Film Productions

results.title: The Sword
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A bird is born on a farm. Once grown, an evil farmer tries to shoot it as he is flying to the sun. Dying, this bird grows to monster proportions and is killed in his tracks by a man who finds a golden sword in the park.

results.title: In search of home
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
A film on child adoption describing how a welfare agency seeks to find the right home for each child placed under its care. How the agency goes about selecting good “parent material” is seen as two childless couples apply for adoption of a child. The first couple demonstrates the type of parental qualities looked for; in the case of the second, there is reason to doubt their ability to provide a healthy emotional environment for an adopted child. We see, too, the need for patient understanding of the delays and complications of placing the right child in the right home.

results.title: Caveboy meets Future Boy
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An animated short of a caveboy who gets killed by hunters and gets transmitted into a future world of violence and war. Robots are evil in this world and caveboy is saved from attack by Future Boy. They come together and escape from this world of fear by being teleported into another future dimension.

results.title: The Choice is yours
results.creator_credit: Fred S Niemann and National Woman's Christian Temperance Union
results.brief_description: Features Dr Andrew C. Ivy, Head of the University of Illinois Professional Schools in Chicago, and a young boy and girl questioning a chemistry teacher about alcohol. Through animation, the film shows physical effects of alcohol.

results.title: Tomorrow's citizens
results.creator_credit: Gordon Weisenborn, Stuart Legg and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”
This film examines contemporary educational methods and policies in the light of an age that has released new natural energies, to be used for or against mankind. It reiterates the question sociologists ask: is the development of social responsibility in today’s children keeping pace with their technical knowledge?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon Weisenborn, Stuart Legg and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Little girl Jaed
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This drama recounts a girl’s tragic journey of drug addiction. Feelings of isolation and loneliness mount as a girl struggles with everyday life - at school and at home. Her friends begin to reject her, as her family does when they can no longer cope with her behaviour. As she tries to come to grips with her dependency, her family bond comes to breaking point and she is eventually thrown out of the family home. A bleak story of how drug addiction can ruin a person’s life.

results.title: Eyes on Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
This discussion of Canada’s international relations looks at the role of industry and agriculture in foreign trade. Canada’s effect on world affairs and the balance of power is also considered.
